member.name: T:Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper
member.summary: The AdoHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common data access uses. It uses the Abstract Factory pattern to be easily extensible to any ADO.NET provider. The current implementation provides helpers for SQL Server, ODBC, OLEDB, and Oracle.

member.name: T:Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper.AdoConnectionOwnership
member.summary: This enum is used to indicate whether the connection was provided by the caller, or created by AdoHelper, so that we can set the appropriate CommandBehavior when calling ExecuteReader()

member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by ADOHelper

member.name: F:Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper.AdoConnectionOwnership.External
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by the caller

member.name: M:Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.IDataParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of IDataParameters to an IDbCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of IDataParameterParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper.ExecuteDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.IDataParameter[])
member.summary: Execute an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.

example.code: DataSet ds = helper.ExecuteDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", new IDbParameter("@prodid", 24));

member.param: A valid connection string for an IDbConnection
The stored procedure name or SQL command
An array of IDbParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command
member.exception: Thrown if any of the IDataParameters.ParameterNames are null, or if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied
Thrown if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied

member.name: M:Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper.ExecuteDataset(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via an IDbCommand (that returns a resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.remarks: This method provides no access to output parameters or the stored procedure's return value parameter.
member.param: A valid connection string for an IDbConnection
The name of the stored procedure
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: A DataSet containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.IDataParameter[],Data4Net.Ado.AdoHelper.AdoConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare an IDbCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid IDbConnection, on which to execute this command
The stored procedure name or SQL command
An array of IDataParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by AdoHelper
member.returns: IDataReader containing the results of the command
member.exception: Thrown if any of the IDataParameters.ParameterNames are null, or if the parameter count does not match the number of values supplied

member.name: T:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.LogErrorMethod
T:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient
member.summary: Memcached client main class. Use the static methods Setup and GetInstance to setup and get an instance of the client for use.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Setup(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Static method for creating an instance. This method will throw an exception if the name already exists.
member.param: A list of memcached servers in standard notation: host:port. If port is omitted, the default value of 11211 is used. Both IP addresses and host names are accepted, for example: "localhost", "127.0.0.1", "cache01.example.com:12345", "127.0.0.1:12345", etc.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Static method which checks if a given named MemcachedClient instance exists.

member.name: F:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.defaultInstance
member.summary: Static method for getting the default instance named "default".

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.GetInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Static method for getting an instance. This method will first check for named instances that has been set up programmatically. If no such instance exists, it will check the "beitmemcached" section of the standard config file and see if it can find configuration info for it there. If that also fails, an exception is thrown.
member.returns: The named instance.

member.name: P:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.KeyPrefix
member.summary: If you specify a key prefix, it will be appended to all keys before they are sent to the memcached server. They key prefix is not used when calculating which server a key belongs to.

member.name: P:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.SendReceiveTimeout
member.summary: The send receive timeout is used to determine how long the client should wait for data to be sent and received from the server, specified in milliseconds. The default value is 2000.

member.name: P:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: The connect timeout is used to determine how long the client should wait for a connection to be established, specified in milliseconds. The default value is 2000.

member.name: P:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.MinPoolSize
member.summary: The min pool size determines the number of sockets the socket pool will keep. Note that no sockets will be created on startup, only on use, so the socket pool will only contain this amount of sockets if the amount of simultaneous requests goes above it. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.MaxPoolSize
member.summary: The max pool size determines how large the socket connection pool is allowed to grow. There can be more sockets in use than this amount, but when the extra sockets are returned, they will be destroyed. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.SocketRecycleAge
member.summary: If the pool contains more than the minimum amount of sockets, and a socket is returned that is older than this recycle age that socket will be destroyed instead of put back in the pool. This allows the pool to shrink back to the min pool size after a peak in usage. The default value is 30 minutes.

member.name: P:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.CompressionThreshold
member.summary: If an object being stored is larger in bytes than the compression threshold, it will internally be compressed before begin stored, and it will transparently be decompressed when retrieved. Only strings, byte arrays and objects can be compressed. The default value is 1048576 bytes = 1MB.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.hash(System.String)
member.summary: Private key hashing method that uses the modified FNV hash.
member.returns: The hashed key.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.hash(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Private hashing method for user-supplied hash values.
member.param: The user-supplied hash value to hash.
member.returns: The hashed value

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.hash(System.String[])
member.param: An array of keys to hash.
member.returns: An arrays of hashes.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.hash(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Private multi-hashing method for user-supplied hash values.
member.param: An array of keys to hash.
member.returns: An arrays of hashes.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.checkKey(System.String)
member.summary: Private key-checking method. Throws an exception if the key does not conform to memcached protocol requirements: It may not contain whitespace, it may not be null or empty, and it may not be longer than 250 characters.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Set(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "set" command in the memcached protocol. It will unconditionally set the given key to the given value. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully set.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Set(System.String,System.Object,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "set" command in the memcached protocol. It will unconditionally set the given key to the given value. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully set.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "add" command in the memcached protocol. It will set the given key to the given value only if the key does not already exist. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully added.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.UInt32)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "add" command in the memcached protocol. It will set the given key to the given value only if the key does not already exist. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully added.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Get(System.String)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "get" command in the memcached protocol. It will return the value for the given key. It will return null if the key did not exist, or if it was unable to retrieve the value. If given an array of keys, it will return a same-sized array of objects with the corresponding values. Use the overload to specify a custom hash to override server selection.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.SetCounter(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: This method sets the key to the given value, and stores it in a format such that the methods Increment and Decrement can be used successfully on it, i.e. decimal representation of a 64-bit unsigned integer. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the counter was successfully set.

member.summary: This method corresponds to the "incr" command in the memcached protocol. It will increase the item with the given value and return the new value. member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.Decrement(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "decr" command in the memcached protocol. It will decrease the item with the given value and return the new value. If the new value would be less than 0, it will be set to 0, and the method will return 0. It will return null if the item did not exist, was not stored properly as per the SetCounter method, or if it was not able to successfully retrieve the item.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.FlushAll
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "flush_all" command in the memcached protocol. When this method is called, it will send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on all servers. Use the overloads to set a delay for the flushing. If the parameter staggered is set to true, the client will increase the delay for each server, i.e. the first will flush after delay*0, the second after delay*1, the third after delay*2, etc. If set to false, all servers will flush after the same delay. It returns true if the command was successful on all servers.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.FlushAll(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "flush_all" command in the memcached protocol. When this method is called, it will send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on all servers. Use the overloads to set a delay for the flushing. If the parameter staggered is set to true, the client will increase the delay for each server, i.e. the first will flush after delay*0, the second after delay*1, the third after delay*2, etc. If set to false, all servers will flush after the same delay. It returns true if the command was successful on all servers.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.MemcachedClient.FlushAll(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "flush_all" command in the memcached protocol. member.name: F:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.SocketPool.deadEndPointSecondsUntilRetry
member.summary: If the host stops responding, we mark it as dead for this amount of seconds, and we double this for each consecutive failed retry. If the host comes alive again, we reset this to 1 again.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.SocketPool.getEndPoint(System.String)
member.summary: This method parses the given string into an IPEndPoint. If the string is malformed in some way, or if the host cannot be resolved, this method will throw an exception.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.SocketPool.Acquire
member.summary: Gets a socket from the pool. If there are no free sockets, a new one will be created. If something goes wrong while creating the new socket, this pool's endpoint will be marked as dead and all subsequent calls to this method will return null until the retry interval has passed.

member.name: M:Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.SocketPool.Return(Data4Net.BeIT.MemCached.PooledSocket)
member.summary: Returns a socket to the pool. If the socket is dead, it will be destroyed. If there are more than MaxPoolSize sockets in the pool, it will be destroyed. If there are less than MinPoolSize sockets in the pool, it will always be put back. If there are something inbetween those values, the age of the socket is checked. If it is older than the SocketRecycleAge, it is destroyed, otherwise it will be put back in the pool.

Debug LogLevel: new file in website, name is "LogRunInfo.ashx"
<%@ WebHandler Language="C#" Class="LogRunInfo" %>
using System;
using System.Web;
public class LogRunInfo : IHttpHandler {
public void ProcessRequest (HttpContext context) {
string msg = "";
msg += Data4Net.LogLevel.PrintLogLevelRunInfo(Environment.NewLine); //
msg += Environment.NewLine + Environment.NewLine + Environment.NewLine;
msg += Data4Net.MonitorGo.GetAllInfo(Environment.NewLine); //
context.Response.ContentType = "text/plain";
context.Response.Cache.SetCacheability(HttpCacheability.NoCache);
context.Response.Write(msg);
}
public bool IsReusable {
get {
return false;
}
}
}

member.name: T:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the configuration settings in the Web.config for the RewriterRule.
member.remarks:
This class defines the structure of the Rewriter configuration file in the Web.config file. Currently, it allows only for a set of rewrite rules; however, this approach allows for customization. For example, you could provide a ruleset that doesn't use regular expression matching; or a set of constant names and values, which could then be referenced in rewrite rules.
The structure in the Web.config file is as follows:
<configuration> <configSections> <section name="RewriterConfig" type="URLRewriter.Config.RewriterConfigSerializerSectionHandler, URLRewriter" /> </configSections>
<RewriterConfig> <Rules> <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern</LookFor> <SendTo>replace with</SendTo> </RewriterRule> <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern</LookFor> <SendTo>replace with</SendTo> </RewriterRule> ... <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern</LookFor> <SendTo>replace with</SendTo> </RewriterRule> </Rules> </RewriterConfig>
<system.web> ... </system.web> </configuration>

member.name: M:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterConfiguration.GetConfig
member.summary: GetConfig() returns an instance of the RewriterConfiguration class with the values populated from the Web.config file. It uses XML deserialization to convert the XML structure in Web.config into a RewriterConfiguration instance.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: P:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterConfiguration.Rules
member.summary: A instance that provides access to a set of s.

member.name: T:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterRule
member.summary: Represents a rewriter rule. A rewriter rule is composed of a pattern to search for and a string to replace the pattern with (if matched).

member.name: P:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterRule.LookFor
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern to look for.
member.remarks:
LookFor is a regular expression pattern. Therefore, you might need to escape characters in the pattern that are reserved characters in regular expression syntax (., ?, ^, $, etc.).
The pattern is searched for using the System.Text.RegularExpression.Regex class's IsMatch() method. The pattern is case insensitive.

member.name: P:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterRule.SendTo
member.summary: The string to replace the pattern with, if found.
member.remarks: The replacement string may use grouping symbols, like $1, $2, etc. Specifically, the System.Text.RegularExpression.Regex class's Replace() method is used to replace the match in with the value in SendTo.

member.name: T:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterRuleCollection
member.summary: The RewriterRuleCollection models a set of RewriterRules in the Web.config file.
member.remarks:
The RewriterRuleCollection is expressed in XML as:
<RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern to search for</LookFor> <SendTo>string to redirect to</LookFor> <RewriterRule> <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern to search for</LookFor> <SendTo>string to redirect to</LookFor> <RewriterRule> ... <RewriterRule> <LookFor>pattern to search for</LookFor> <SendTo>string to redirect to</LookFor> <RewriterRule>

member.name: M:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterRuleCollection.Add(Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterRule)
member.summary: Adds a new RewriterRule to the collection.

member.name: P:Data4Net.URLRewriter.Config.RewriterRuleCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets a RewriterRule at a specified ordinal index.

member.name: T:Data4Net.URLRewriter.RewriterFactoryHandler
member.summary: Provides an HttpHandler that performs redirection.
member.remarks: The RewriterFactoryHandler checks the rewriting rules, rewrites the path if needed, and then delegates the responsibility of processing the ASP.NET page to the PageParser class (the same one used by the PageHandlerFactory class).

member.name: M:Data4Net.URLRewriter.RewriterFactoryHandler.GetHandler(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: GetHandler is executed by the ASP.NET pipeline after the associated HttpModules have run. The job of GetHandler is to return an instance of an HttpHandler that can process the page.
member.param: The HTTP data transfer method (GET or POST)
The RawUrl of the requested resource.
The physical path to the requested resource.
member.returns: An instance that implements IHttpHandler; specifically, an HttpHandler instance returned by the PageParser class, which is the same class that the default ASP.NET PageHandlerFactory delegates to.
